data.title: BERKEL
data.text:
HOME CHART

HANS JACOB BERKEL (c. 1680 - bet. 1739-1760)  p. IMMIGRANT

About 1680 HANS JACOB BERKEL was born in Palatinate, Prussia. HANS JACOBs parents are unknown.

KINGS WILLIAMS WAR 1689-1679

FRENCH & INDIAN WARS 1689-1763

1700 (about): HANS JACOB MARRIED ANNA BARBARA

About 1700 HANS JACOB (age 20) married Anna Barbara (maiden name unknown) in Palatinate, Prussia. HANS JACOB and Anna Barbara had at least two children:

Hans Jacob (Jr.) (b. about 1704)

MARIA MAGDALENA (b. about 1706)

1733: IMMIGRATION TO AMERICA

On 29 September 1733 HANS JACOB and family arrived in the port of Philadelphia on the Delaware River aboard the Pink Lady (also called Mary or Pink Mary) from Rotterdam, Holland (the Netherlands) and settled in Lebanon, Lancaster County, Pennsylvania.

1739 - 1760 (between): DEATH OF HANS JACOB

Between 1739 - 1760 HANS JACOB died - probably in Pennsylvania.

***

Notes On Hans Jacob Berkel

The Family History Collection of Arden Gremmert and Eva Doherty Hans Jacob BERKEL http://users.legacyfamilytree.com/EvaGremmert/3/38469.htm SEE WEBSITE SOURCE INDEX.

NOTE:

Palatinate / Holy Roman Empire (Now Rhine Valley, Germany).

Prussia became part of a united Germany in 1871.

Various spellings of surname: Pirtle; Purtle; Bierckel; Birkel; Birckel; Birckle; Berkel; Berkley; Barclay; Barkley.

The origin of the Pirtle name - a european genealogist(Herr von Franck) stated that nowhere in his more than 1 million surnames, did he have anything on the name Pirtle, and suggested that this was not the original spelling. He seemed to think that it was probably Burkle or Burkel...with two little dots over the "u", and that it was either Swiss or German..although he said the family could have lived in Alsace-Lorraine (France).

back to top

MARIA MAGDALENA BERKEL (c. 1706 - aft. 1759)  p. IMMIGRANT

FRENCH & INDIAN WARS 1689-1763

About 1706 MARIA MAGDALENA BERKEL was born in Palatinate, Prussia. MARIAs parents are Hans Jacob Berkel and Anna Barbara (maiden name unknown).

1738 (before): IMMIGRATION TO AMERICA

Before 15 October 1738 MARIA had immigrated to America.

1738: MARRIAGE OF MARIA AND ANDREA CRAMER

On 15 October 1738 MARIA (age 32) married Andreas Cramer (Kraemer) in the Lutheran Church, Lancaster County, Pennsylvania. MARIA and Andreas had at least nine children:

Ludwig (b. about 1739)

Andrew (b. 1740)

Daniel (b. 1743)

GEORGE (b. 1745)

John Jacob (b. 1749)

Adam (b. 14 October 1752)

Christian (b. 1756)

Rosina (b. 1758)

Michael (b. 1759)

1759 (after): DEATH OF MARIA

After 1759 MARIA MAGDALENA (age 53) died in Berks County, Pennsylvania.

***

Notes On Maria Magdalena Berkel

NOTE:

Palatinate / Holy Roman Empire (Now Rhine Valley, Germany).

Prussia became part of a united Germany in 1871.

Various spellings of surname: Pirtle; Purtle; Bierckel; Birkel; Birckel; Birckle; Berkel; Berkley; Barclay; Barkley.

The origin of the Pirtle name - a european genealogist(Herr von Franck) stated that nowhere in his more than 1 million surnames, did he have anything on the name Pirtle, and suggested that this was not the original spelling. He seemed to think that it was probably Burkle or Burkel...with two little dots over the "u", and that it was either Swiss or German..although he said the family could have lived in Alsace-Lorraine (France).
